alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 29 at 2:29PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Teton and northwestern Cascade Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 229 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Fort Shaw, or 16 miles west of Great Falls, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Power, Vaughn and Sun River. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton
